html_lawbox:
376 U.S. 201 (1964)

DIAMOND
v.
LOUISIANA.

No. 100.

Supreme Court of United States.

Argued February 20, 1964.
Decided February 24, 1964.
CERTIORARI TO THE SUPREME COURT OF LOUISIANA.

James M. Nabrit III argued the cause for petitioner. With him on the brief were Jack Greenberg, Wiley A. Branton and Johnnie A. Jones.

Ralph L. Roy argued the cause for respondent. With him on the brief was Jack P. F. Gremillion, Attorney General of Louisiana.

PER CURIAM.

The writ of certiorari is dismissed as improvidently granted.

html:
376 U.S. 201

84 S.Ct. 696

11 L.Ed.2d 650

Dion Tyrone DIAMOND, petitioner,
v.
STATE OF LOUISIANA.

No. 100.

Supreme Court of the United States

October Term, 1963.

February 24, 1964

James M. Nabrit, III, New York City, for petitioner.

Ralph L. Roy, Baton Rouge, La., for respondent.

On Writ of Certiorari to the Supreme Court of Louisiana.

PER CURIAM.

1

The writ of certiorari is dismissed as improvidently granted.
